meanings.definition: A mythical creature used to frighten children.
meanings.sent1: The children whispered about the boogeymen hiding in their closets.
meanings.sent2: Parents often mention the boogeymen to warn kids to behave.
meanings.sent3: The boogeymen must have been on vacation since the kids weren't scared at all.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the night seemed to bring the boogeymen to life in the kids' imaginations.
meanings.sent5: The illustrator's depiction of the boogeymen made them look truly terrifying.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is widely regarded as an object of fear or avoidance.
meanings.sent1: The criminal was seen as the boogeymen of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house was the ultimate boogeymen for the local kids.
meanings.sent3: The boogeymen of the office turned out to be the harmless office cat.
meanings.sent4: The rumors about the haunted forest turned it into the boogeymen of the town.
meanings.sent5: The old mansion had a reputation as the boogeymen of the town, scaring away visitors.
